title: Hug Day greeting card background blending and emoji overlay layering

requirements.summary: Make the greeting message card visually share the same background as the page (remove white card contrast) without changing text or moving/resizing the photo.
acceptanceCriteria: The message card container no longer renders with a white background that contrasts against the page background.
The page background and the message/card background visually match (same background color/gradient).
The photo remains in the same location within the layout as before (no reordering or relocation), and the text content is unchanged.

file_operations.description: Remove the explicit white background styling from the message card container (e.g., replace the current bg-white treatment with a transparent/inherited background) while keeping the existing markup structure so text content and the image URL/placement remain unchanged.

Adjust any card-specific styling (e.g., card container background-related styles if present/added) to ensure the card area visually matches the page background gradient/color, without altering global body background or changing the image positioning.

requirements.summary: Ensure the floating emoji/hearts rain renders as a non-interactive overlay above all greeting page content while keeping existing spawn/burst behavior unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: Floating emojis/hearts appear on top of the heading, message text, signature, and photo (not behind them).
The emoji overlay remains non-interactive (clicks/taps still work normally on the page; the emoji layer does not capture pointer events).
The existing emoji burst/spawn behavior remains unchanged (initial burst, continuous spawning cadence, and click burst).

file_operations.description: Update the stacking order for the emoji overlay by raising the z-index of the floating emoji container (and, if needed, the individual floating emoji elements) so it layers above the greeting content, while keeping pointer-events disabled to avoid blocking interactions.

Verify/wire the intended layer ordering between the greeting content and FloatingEmojiRain (ensure the overlay is not placed behind content due to z-index/stacking contexts) without changing the emoji behavior or adding new routes/pages.
